channel.title: Listen to the land
channel.description:
A profile of a nation in terms of its living language. By sharing aloud the writings of the United States, past and present, a fuller appreciation of what it means to be American can be found. ,America's literary heritage is explored through readings of short stories, poems, folklore, journalism and legends. The series is narrated by Richard S. Burdick.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Barracks, battlefields, & birthrights, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on American literature related to war, particularly the American Revolution.
item.dc:creator: Catton, Bruce, 1899-1978
item.dc:subject: Writing

item.title: The fertile Twenties, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on the exceptional American writings of the 1920s.
